## How to read this schedule

This course repeats one story all semester:

**Measure → Infer → Balance → Evolve**

Reading labels:

- **Required (Core):** expected reading (counts toward weekly page totals)
- **Recommended / Skim:** optional support (does *not* count toward weekly totals)
- **Optional practice:** end-of-chapter *Questions & Exercises* (only assigned when stated)

> Page totals are estimates from the Table of Contents page ranges.

## Important dates

- **First class:** Tue **Jan 20, 2026**
- **Exam 1 (in class):** Thu **Mar 5, 2026**
- **Exam 2 (in class):** Thu **Apr 16, 2026**
- **Spring Break (no class):** Tue **Mar 31** & Thu **Apr 2**
- **Last class (synthesis + optional review):** Tue **May 5**
- **Final Exam:** Thu **May 7** 10:30 am - 12:30 pm | **Room:** LH 249

## Module 3 — Stellar structure, evolution, and the stellar graveyard (Weeks 8–12)

> This module includes hydrostatic equilibrium, transport, fusion, scaling relations, and **stellar endpoints** (white dwarfs / neutron stars / black holes).  
> We also cover **minimum and maximum stellar masses**, including a short Quantum Mechanics/de Broglie motivation for the minimum mass.

| Week | Dates | Topics (in class) | Required reading (Core) | Core pages |
|:-|:--|:-----|:--|:-|
| 8 | Mar 10 & 12 | Ages & lifetimes; timescale reasoning<br>Hydrostatic equilibrium + virial temperature (thermal lens) | Ch 8 (pp. 49–51) + Ch 15 (pp. 101–104) | 7 |
| 9 | Mar 17 & 19 | Radiation transport: diffusion, radiation pressure, atmosphere vs depth<br>Radiative vs convective envelopes | Ch 16 (pp. 107–110) + Ch 17 (pp. 112–116) | 9 |
| 10 | Mar 24 & 26 | Fusion ignition + main-sequence scalings<br>Min/max masses: brown dwarfs (QM + de Broglie) & Eddington limit | Ch 18 (pp. 120–124) | 5 |
| Spring Break | Mar 31 & Apr 2 | — No class — | — | — |
| 11 | Apr 7 & 9 | Low-mass evolution → white dwarfs<br>Degeneracy pressure + Chandrasekhar limit (conceptual QM/stat-phys) | Ch 19 (pp. 128–134) | 7 |
| 12 | Apr 14 & 16 | High-mass evolution → core-collapse supernovae<br>Neutron stars + black holes; where GR matters (conceptual)<br>Thu: **EXAM 2** | Ch 20.1–20.5 (pp. 137–143) | 7 |
